009package imagingbook.common.pdf;
010
011import java.awt.Graphics2D;
012import java.awt.color.ColorSpace;
013import java.awt.color.ICC_Profile;
014import java.io.FileNotFoundException;
015import java.io.FileOutputStream;
016import java.io.IOException;
017import java.nio.file.Path;
018
019import com.lowagie.text.BadElementException;
020import com.lowagie.text.Document;
021import com.lowagie.text.DocumentException;
022import com.lowagie.text.Image;
023import com.lowagie.text.Rectangle;
024import com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfContentByte;
025import com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfGraphics2D;
026import com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfWriter;
027
028import ij.ImagePlus;
029import ij.gui.Overlay;
030import ij.gui.Roi;
031import imagingbook.common.util.ParameterBundle;
032import imagingbook.core.Info;
033
034
035/**
036 * Exports an {@link ImagePlus} instance, including its vector overly
037 * (if existent) to a PDF file.
038 * Configuration is accomplished by passing a {@link PdfExporter.Parameters}
039 * instance to the constructor.
040 * If selected, core Type1 fonts are substituted and embedded in the PDF.
041 * 
042 * @author WB
043 * @version 2022/03/15
044 */
045public class PdfExporter {
046
047        private static double MinStrokeWidth = 0.01;            // substitute for zero-width strokes
048
049        private final Parameters params;
050        private final ImagePlus im;
051
052        /**
053         * Parameter bundle for class {@link PdfExporter}.
054         * Annotations are used for inserting the complete parameter bundle in
055         * ImageJ's {@code GenericDialog}.
056         */
057        public static class Parameters implements ParameterBundle {
058
059                @DialogLabel("Author:")
060                public String author = System.getProperty("user.name");
061                @DialogLabel("Title:")
062                public String title = null;
063
064                @DialogLabel("Subject:")
065                public String subject = "";
066
067                @DialogLabel("Keywords:")
068                public String keywords = "";
069
070                @DialogLabel("Include raster image:")
071                public boolean includeImage = true;
072                @DialogLabel("Upscale image:")
073                public boolean upscaleImage = true;
074                @DialogLabel("Upscale factor:")@DialogDigits(0)
075                public int upscaleFactor = 1;
076                @DialogLabel("Add sRGB color profile:")
077                public boolean addIccProfile = true;
078
079                @DialogLabel("Include vector overlay:")
080                public boolean includeOverlay = true;
081                @DialogLabel("Min. stroke width:")@DialogDigits(2)
082                public double minStrokeWidth = MinStrokeWidth;
083                @DialogLabel("Embed core fonts:")
084                public boolean embedCoreFonts = true;
085
086                @DialogLabel("Include image props:")
087                public boolean includeImageProps = true;
088
089                @DialogHide
090                public boolean debug = false;
091                
092                @Override
093                public boolean validate() {
094                        return 
095                        upscaleFactor >= 1 && 
096                        minStrokeWidth >= 0;
097                }
098        }
099
100        // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
101
102        public PdfExporter(ImagePlus im, Parameters params) {
103                this.im = im;
104                this.params = params;
105        }
106
107        public PdfExporter(ImagePlus im) {
108                this(im, new Parameters());
109        }
110
111        // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
112
113        public String exportTo(Path path) {
114                final int width  = im.getWidth();       // original image size
115                final int height = im.getHeight();
116                Overlay overlay = im.getOverlay();      // original overlay (if any)
117
118                // Step 1: create the PDF document
119                Rectangle pageSize = new Rectangle(width, height);
120                
121                try (Document document = new Document(pageSize)) {
122
123                        // Step 2: create a PDF writer
124                        PdfWriter writer = null;
125                        try {
126                                writer = PdfWriter.getInstance(document, new FileOutputStream(path.toFile()));
127                        } catch (DocumentException | FileNotFoundException e) {
128                                if (params.debug) System.out.println("Could no create PdfWriter to path " + path.toString());
129                                return null;
130                        }
131
132                        // Step 3: open the document and set various properties (TODO)
133                        document.open();
134                        document.addTitle(params.title);
135                        document.addAuthor(params.author);
136                        document.addSubject(params.subject);    
137                        document.addKeywords(params.keywords);
138                        document.addCreationDate();                     
139                        document.addCreator("ImageJ Plugin (imagingbook)");
140                        document.addProducer(this.getClass().getName() + " " + Info.getVersionInfo());
141
142                        // Step 4: create a template and the associated Graphics2D context
143                        PdfContentByte cb = writer.getDirectContent();
144
145                        // Step 5: set sRGB default viewing profile
146                        if (params.addIccProfile) {
147                                ICC_Profile colorProfile = ICC_Profile.getInstance(ColorSpace.CS_sRGB);
148                                try {
149                                        writer.setOutputIntents("Custom", null, "http://www.color.org", "sRGB IEC61966-2.1", colorProfile);
150                                } catch (IOException e) { 
151                                        if (params.debug) System.out.println("Could not add ICC profile!");
152                                }
153                                //byte[] iccdata = java.awt.color.ICC_Profile.getInstance(ColorSpace.CS_sRGB).getData();
154                                //com.itextpdf.text.pdf.ICC_Profile icc = com.itextpdf.text.pdf.ICC_Profile.getInstance(iccdata);
155                        }
156
157                        // Step 6: insert the image
158                        if (params.includeImage) {
159                                ImagePlus im2 = this.im;
160                                int upscale = params.upscaleFactor;
161                                if (upscale > 1) {      // upscale the image if needed (without interpolation)
162                                        im2 = im.resize(width * upscale, height * upscale, "none");
163                                }
164                                
165                                try {
166                                        Image pdfImg = com.lowagie.text.Image.getInstance(im2.getImage(), null);
167                                        pdfImg.setAbsolutePosition(0, 0);
168                                        pdfImg.scaleToFit(width, height);       // fit to the original size             
169                                        cb.addImage(pdfImg);
170                                } catch (BadElementException | IOException e) {
171                                        if (params.debug) System.out.println("Could not insert image!");
172                                        return null;
173                                }
174                        }
175
176                        // Step 7: draw the vector overlay
177                        if (overlay != null && params.includeOverlay) {
178                                // https://stackoverflow.com/questions/17667615/how-can-itext-embed-font-used-by-jfreechart-for-chart-title-and-labels?rq=1
179                                Graphics2D g2 = (params.embedCoreFonts) ? 
180                                                new PdfGraphics2D(cb, width, height, new CoreFontMapper(), false, false, 0) : 
181                                                new PdfGraphics2D(cb, width, height); // no core font embedding
182
183                                Roi[] roiArr = overlay.toArray();
184                                for (Roi roi : roiArr) {
185                                        double sw = roi.getStrokeWidth();
186                                        if (sw < params.minStrokeWidth) {       // sometimes stroke width is simply not set (= 0)
187                                                roi.setStrokeWidth(params.minStrokeWidth);      // temporarily change stroke width
188                                        }
189                                        ImagePlus tmpIm = roi.getImage();
190                                        roi.setImage(null);     // trick learned from Wayne to ensure magnification is 1
191                                        roi.drawOverlay(g2);    // replacement (recomm. by Wayne)
192                                        roi.setImage(tmpIm);
193                                        if (sw < 0.001f) {
194                                                roi.setStrokeWidth(sw); // restore original stroke width
195                                        }       
196                                }
197                                g2.dispose();
198                        }
199
200                        // Step 8: copy ImagePlus custom properties to PDF
201                        if (params.includeImageProps) {
202                                String[] props = im.getPropertiesAsArray();
203                                if (props != null) {
204                                        for (int i = 0; i < props.length; i+=2) {
205                                                String key = props[i];
206                                                String val = props[i + 1];
207                                                document.addHeader(key, val);
208                                        }
209                                }
210                        }
211
212                        // Step 9: close PDF document
213                        //document.close();
214                }       // auto-close
215                
216                return path.toAbsolutePath().toString();
217        }
218
219}
